title.value: Adeno-associated virus (AAV) gene therapy for spinal muscular atrophy
title.justification: This title is specific to the study reported by Hugh McMillan in the Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario (CHEO) Research Institute regarding the AAV9-mediated gene therapy in spinal muscular atrophy as mentioned in the text.
title.quote:
Adeno-associated virus (AAV) gene therapy for spinal muscular atrophy

Hugh Mcmillan, Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario (CHEO) Research
Institute, Pediatrics, Ontario, Canada

extractions.description: The paper discusses the advances and impacts of AAV9-mediated gene therapies for spinal muscular atrophy (SMA), focusing on several studies including SPR1NT, SMART, and STRONG. The challenges and considerations for AAV9-related side effects are also reviewed.

type.justification: The paper discusses the results of studies like SPR1NT, SMART, and STRONG, indicating that empirical evidence and observations are used to evaluate the AAV9-mediated gene therapies.
type.quote:
Results of the
Phase 3, SPR1NT study (NCT03505099) will be highlighted, where
presymptomatic infants (b 6 wks old), were treated with a single dose of
intravenous (IV) onasemnogene abeparvovec.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on AAV gene therapy, which is a form of gene therapy used to treat spinal muscular atrophy.
name.quote: Adeno-associated virus (AAV) gene therapy for spinal muscular atrophy

name.justification: The paper is focused on spinal muscular atrophy, which affects the neurological system, thus making Neurology a relevant sub-field.
name.quote: Spinal muscular atrophy (SMA) is a hereditary disorder characterized by the progressive loss of motor neurons with resulting muscle atrophy and weakness.

name.justification: The paper discusses several trial studies focusing on Onasemnogene Abeparvovec, which is the AAV9-mediated gene therapy used.
name.quote:
where
presymptomatic infants (b 6 wks old), were treated with a single dose of
intravenous (IV) onasemnogene abeparvovec.

is_contributed.justification: The paper provides empirical research and results regarding the therapy, indicating contribution to the field by discussing its development and evaluation.
is_contributed.quote:
Results of the STRONG study (NCT03381729) will be highlighted where children 6 to 60 months old received a single
intrathecal (IT) dose of onasemnogene abeparvovec.

is_executed.justification: The model is executed in the studies mentioned (SPR1NT, STRONG, and SMART), providing data on its use and effects.
is_executed.quote:
Results of the
Phase 3, SPR1NT study (NCT03505099) will be highlighted, where
presymptomatic infants ... were treated with a single dose of
intravenous (IV) onasemnogene abeparvovec.

is_compared.justification: The paper does not discuss a comparison between Onasemnogene Abeparvovec and other treatments within the text provided.
is_compared.quote:
AAV9-related side
effects will be reviewed with a view to discussing vector, disease and
patient-specific considerations when evaluating potential candidacy for
gene replacement therapy.

referenced_paper_title.value: Adeno-associated virus (AAV) gene therapy for spinal muscular atrophy
referenced_paper_title.justification: The section and studies discussed revolve around the use and implications of Onasemnogene Abeparvovec.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Adeno-associated virus (AAV) gene therapy for spinal muscular atrophy
